intro: Hieracium apenninum, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium apenninum is often found in open habitats and can form dense colonies, sometimes becoming invasive in certain regions.
